lexUnit.name: invent.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: create or design (a new device, process, etc.).

sentence.text: This is a game I invented to allow me to get some exercise and amuse my children at the same time .
` Rockist " was the term invented to describe people who played rude guitars and were noisy , ie U2 , Echo And The Bunnymen and Motorhead .
A company in Wales , Mixalloy , is exploiting a process that the British Steel Corporation invented to mix metal powders with other powders to make all sorts of chemicals with new properties .
Did n't you know that these were not originally invented to wind yarn on to ?
Darwin invented a special theory to solve the problem , his theory of sexual selection .
At the same time Nelson invented a freezer for ready-made products , now known to the frozen food industry as the ` Nelson Box " .
After Rowland Hill invented the Penny Black in 1840 , Britain 's postal system was adopted the world over .
William Perkin , an Englishman , invented the first man-made dyes in 1856 .
Du Pont in the USA had invented nylon in the late 1930s and it was clear that the material would be of tremendous use to countries at war .
` An estate agent submitted a gadget he had invented years before which was sitting up in his loft , but he needed the money so tried his luck and sent it in . "
Hermes " musical talent ensured he remained a favourite with the gods , and he was credited with inventing the lyre from a tortoise shell .
The Minoans did not invent the technique of carving shell : it was used earlier , in the Cyclades , for making figurines and bracelets .
A scientist claims he 's invented a way of making charcoal which could be a life-saver in third world countries desperately short of fuel .
HIDEKI YUKAWA is one of the acknowledged geniuses of modern physics : he invented the pi-meson .
First , that civilisation was invented by the Egyptians and then plagiarised and corrupted by the Greeks .
This thing was invented by one mad professor guy , like Eddison , " said Sam .
Ecstasy technically MDMA was invented by German chemists in 1914 as an appetite suppressant .
These index numbers , using base period value weights , were invented by the German economist Laspeyres .
Button badges were invented in America in 1896 as a cheap way of promoting candidates in a presidential election .
An American scientist has invented a fuel cell which he claims can store hydrogen safely , thus making possible its commercial use as a power source .
The French have invented a perfume spray , mostly lemon , which stops dogs barking .
Thomas Cook changed all that and practically invented the tourist industry single-handed , although his first efforts were often financially unrewarding and he kept his ` day " job as a printer .
This priest outfit must be the most uncomfortable garment ever invented for Jungle travel .
The only machine used by these craftsmen was a pole-lathe , the earliest device invented for turning wood .
The standard system for doing this is double entry bookkeeping , invented in the fifteenth century by an Italian monk .
Six is best remembered for the self-registering thermometer which he invented , the first to record maximum and minimum temperatures on a single instrument .
